programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: Ed Shin is an entrepreneur, churchgoer and family man; when his business partner suddenly vanishes, prompting the family to seek answers, a private eye digs into Shin's past and finds something horrifying.

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: How multibillion-dollar company Pacific Gas & Electric comes to repeatedly kill its customers by putting profits over safety as alleged by critics.

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: Karl Karlsen is a hardworking man with what seems to be a terrible streak of bad luck, as his wife and son both die in accidents nearly 20 years apart; Karl has a secret: their suspicious deaths have been keeping his bank account full.

programme.title: American Greed
programme.sub-title: The Life & Crimes of Joel Greenberg
programme.desc: Joel Greenberg is a privileged millennial from a rich Florida family who one day decides to run for Seminole County Tax Collector and wins; once in office, he embarks on a breathtaking series of crimes, ranging from fraud to sex trafficking.

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: Former employees, whistleblowers, and even a family friend-turned-foe provide new insights into the company's leadership and the mysterious long-term relationship between Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes and her top deputy, Sunny Balwani.

programme.title: Restaurant Startup
programme.desc: Bastianich and Love look to the East for delicious flavors and high profits; two young women impress the high-tech denizens of San Francisco at Rice Paper Scissors; the Lone Wolf food truck has a new American spin on classic Vietnamese banh mi.

programme.title: Restaurant Startup
programme.desc: The owner of an Atlanta food truck loses money in a Ponzi scheme; a chef that was forced to shutter his popular restaurant in order to pay for a lengthy custody battle.

programme.title: Restaurant Startup
programme.desc: An edgy Moroccan food catering company with dreams of conquering Manhattan; the funky creation of two sisters who think they make the best plant-based hot dog on the planet.

programme.title: Restaurant Startup
programme.desc: A Los Angeles deli where everything on the menu is roasted to perfection including their signature sliders; a popular chef-driven breakfast café owned by an ex-stockbroker turned restaurateur.

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: Inside the rise and near-collapse of WeWork, the startup co-founded by its former CEO, Adam Neumann, who mesmerizes venture capitalists with grandiose promises, even though WeWork turns out to be a traditional real estate leasing business.

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: T.R. Wright -- the architect of what's been called the wildest insurance fraud scheme Texas has ever seen -- shares his almost-too-crazy-to-be-true story with American Greed.

programme.title: Managing Asia
programme.desc: Christine Tan travels to Japan for an exclusive look at the production process behind SK-II's famous skincare products; Global CEO Sue Kyung Lee gives a guided tour as well as insight into what's next for the beauty brand.

programme.title: Managing Asia
programme.sub-title: Sunil Kant Munjal, Chairman, Hero Enterprise
programme.desc: The Munjal family built a two-wheeler empire in India, producing bicycles and motorcycles under the Hero brand. Christine Tan speaks to Sunil Kant Munjal, Chairman of Hero Enterprise, to find out how the family managed a full throttle rise to prominence.

programme.title: The Leadership League
programme.desc: Michael Johnson sits down with Tania Bryer to discuss his record-breaking career, life off the track and the power of an athlete's voice.

programme.title: Listing Impossible
programme.desc: A $12 million mansion in a golf course community isn't quite the hot commodity its owners hoped it'd be, but Aaron and Morgan are determined to turn up the temperature; Aaron and Arvin clash in the office when Arvin oversteps on a deal.

programme.title: Listing Impossible
programme.desc: Aaron and Neyshia take on a client with a curious preference for purple, only to learn that paint color is the least of their problems with this house.

programme.title: Listing Impossible

programme.title: Live: Squawk Box Asia
programme.desc: The hosts provide in-depth coverage of Asian stock markets and invite experts to offer their predictions and investment tips.

programme.title: Live: Access Middle East
programme.desc: Business journalists Yousef Gamal el-Din and Hadley Gamble are co-hosts of this show that profiles the people who are shaping the Middle East's global ambitions. From CEOs and entrepreneurs to philanthropists and politicians, the episodes give viewers an idea of what is being done to make the Middle East a bigger player in the financial marketplace. Episodes also profile Middle Eastern businesspeople and companies.

programme.title: CNBC Sport: On the Record
programme.desc: Conversations with Avenue Capital Group CEO Marc Lasry, RedBird Capital founder Gerry Cardinale and Ariel Project Level Head of Investments Jason Wright.

programme.title: CNBC Sport: On the Record
programme.desc: Conversations with NFL RedZone host Scott Hanson, former ESPN NBA Insider Adrian Wojnarowski and ESPN Senior NFL Insider Adam Schefter.

programme.title: Live: Squawk Box Europe
programme.desc: "Squawk Box Europe" provides three hours of analysis and debate on trading days to lead up to the open of the European markets. The trio of anchors is joined by business personalities and specialists from the financial markets to discuss what to expect for the upcoming day. The show opens with a look at how the Asian market fared overnight. It then focuses on news that could affect the opening call and futures prices as well as live market trades and market reaction to the day's major stories. Viewers have a chance to get involved in the show by sending in questions and comments via email.

programme.title: Worldwide Exchange
programme.desc: Anchor Frank Holland informs viewers about business stories that have global significance. The conversations include analysis of business and investor trends in international markets. Covering local stories with international significance, reports come in from sites such as New York, Mumbai, Frankfurt, Tokyo, Shanghai, and Dubai, and special guests appear.

programme.title: Curry Inc: The Business of Stephen Curry
programme.desc: Curry Inc: The Business of Stephen Curry explores how the greatest shooter of all time is preparing for life after basketball. Through exclusive interviews with Stephen Curry, his head coach Steve Kerr, and key executives behind his growing business ventures, CNBC Media & Sports Reporter Alex Sherman takes viewers inside Thirty Ink, Curry's growing business empire.
